Long Description: The game is played in a series of rounds. Rounds consist of players taking turns in clockwise order. Taking a turn: Draw a card from the Deck (You will then have 2 cards in your hand) 2. Play a card and apply its effect 3. Pass play to the next player End of a Round: The round ends when there are no more cards in the Deck or when there is only a single player left.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Win glory for your gods to ensure their prominence in the Pantheon.
Long Description: The game can be played in two different ways: ‚Ä¢ Titanomachy: A game for 2-4 players trying to achieve an individual victory. ‚Ä¢ Pantheon: A partnership game for 4 players, played in two teams of 2. In both of these games, the players take actions that represent a bard‚Äôs retelling of the ancient story of They Who Were 8. They may also call upon the powers of their Gods to control the narrative.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: One player is Emily, trying to survive the night; the other player is the Bogeys.
Long Description: No one knows who Emily is until a player picks up the ‚ÄòEmily‚Äô card. How long can they hide their secret before the other player guesses? Once the ‚ÄòRun Emily Run‚Äô card is reached there can be no more bluffing. Play centers around a haunted house built of cards. House cards start face up but as play continues they are played face down and the house becomes increasingly mysterious.
Print Components: 2 Run Emily Run cards, 2 Emily cards, a Front card, a Back card and 12 each of Orange Bogey, Green Bogey, Hiding and Curio cards.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Advanced Crafting (many cards, folding boards, tiles, circle tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: Collect resources to ship the best goods and create the most valuable train-chain!
Long Description: In Yardmaster, 2-5 players compete to build trains comprised of railcars of different goods and values. However, players are restricted in connecting railcars of only the same value or good type, so if you grab a railcar you can't use, it needs to wait in your sorting yard until it can legitimately hook up to your train.
Print Components: 40 railcar cards, 52 cargo cards, 4 engine cards, 4 exchange rate tokens, 1 yardmaster token, rules

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: A 1-2 player cooperative dinner party puzzler.
Long Description: You are the royal hosts‚Äô waitstaff, plating dishes and serving guests while following royal protocol. If the dinner is a failure, the realm will descend into chaos yet again. The fate of the realm now rests on your shoulders. Only you can maintain peace in the realm by making sure that all faction leaders are served fairly and that the royal hosts are satisfied.
Other Components: 6 red cubes, 6 blue cubes, 6 yellow cubes

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Expert Crafting (100's of cards, many boards, many tiles and tokens, unique elements)
One-Sentence Short Description: Explore alien worlds on a limited government budget.
Long Description: Join the Federation Alliance, a bureaucracy with a minimalist budget. Succeed in missions on worlds with unique ecosystems, without luxuries like radios, landing gear, and medical supplies. Trust your partner is paramount since, without radios, you can‚Äôt communicate (in real life) after separating on the game board.
Print Components: player boards, 200+ cards,  mission booklet, 54 hexes, rules

Main Mechanism: Area Control / Area Majority / Territory Control
PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Advanced Crafting (many cards, folding boards, tiles, circle tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: Collect lunar elements - Discover new resources - Dominate and control Moon surface!
Long Description: Players compete in collecting elements discovered on the surface of the Moon. They fight for control over Maria to establish a rewarding Moon dominance. Gameplay introduces and smoothly combines 2 core mechanics of pick up & deliver and area control in a single game. Together with light combat, score rivalry, units, and cards management or team play, it provides a deep, tactical experience.
Print Components: 2 Maps, 52 Mineralis cards, 8 tiles, 46 element tokens, 63 player tokens, 12 Apollo Station tokens

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Build your industrial empire by constructing factories, hiring workers, & producing goods. Will you be rich when you retire?
Long Description: Create a manufacturing empire in 30 years (15 turns) by building factories, producing Capital, Materials, Commodities, and Goods, and earn as much Profit as you can. Each turn consists of three phases: 1. Set the Market 2. Take Your Actions 3.Upkeep/Record Time Passed At the end of each turn, move the marker on the Years in Business track forward one space. The game ends after your 30th year.
Other Components: 7 D6 (colored), 1 D6 (dif color), 1 D6 (dif color), 9 cubes

Main Mechanism: Area Control / Area Majority / Territory Control
PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: "Farrapos" is a tactical game, where military strategy is very important.
Long Description: During 11 rounds each army will win the largest number of cities, adding up the maximum points possible. Each player must organize his troops, composed of tiles of infantry, cavalry and artillery. The clashes follow the style of the best wargames, using dice and tables, for the resolution of battles.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: Squirrels must outguess, outmaneuver, and outsmart the opponent to be the first squirrel to gather five nuts and return home.
Long Description: Nine double-sided tiles are used to form a tight, 3x3 playing grid on which the squirrels move to try to gather nuts. Each player also has six double-sided action tiles, which are used to simultaneously program three actions per round. These actions allow the players not only to move, but also to change the makeup of the board, battle the opposing squirrel, and even change the opponent's actions!

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Grab your bullet. Roll 'em. Shoot your opponent first!
Long Description: You need to shoot quicker, and shoot better than your opponent to win the duel. Before you roll, you bid on the number of dice that you will use (i.e. your gun drawing speed). After you roll your dice, you target your opponent's body parts. Knockout your opponent before he knocks you out. Only one person walks away from a duel. This game involves a level of deduction while pushing your luck.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Solo dungeon-crawler of dice, decisions and death
Long Description: Dust, bones and dried death. A crypt. You catch a wisp of a breeze, heavy with stench. You gag. Yet a breeze suggests a way out. You take a torch, determined to get out of here alive. You loved the choose-your-own-path style of books as a kid. Then you discovered D&D. What Lies Beneath combines the best of both, along with some new game mechanics, in a solo dungeon-crawler narrative.
Other Components: Print character sheet; use hyperlinked PDF for the storyline

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Infection Express is a compact, 1-2 player dice game inspired by Pandemic.
Long Description: Infection Express is a compact, 1-2 player dice game inspired by Pandemic. Using 5 dice instead of the many cards of the original game, it is much quicker to play, whilst maintaining the tension. All that's needed to play are 5 6-sided dice, 56 4-6mm cubes (14 each of 4 colours), 2 player pawn and a print out of the game pdf.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Use your futuristic airship to save fantastic critters from imminent extinction!
Long Description: MoonArk is a cute but challenging solo in-hand strategic card game featuring beautiful hand-drawn Tarot cards and unique gameplay. You must use your rescue ship and capture pods to try and rescue 10 rare animals from the hazards of an alien world, including forest fires, poachers and other less friendly animals. Will you succeed before the environment becomes too hazardous to navigate?

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Build your chateau using your own special skills
Long Description: You are an architect drawing up plans for a variety of buildings. You will use different shapes based on die rolls to put together your floor plan.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Play the role of a frantic barista, as you manage orders and craft coffee drinks.
Long Description: Rent for your apartment is due, and unless you can collect at least 7 tips before your shift ends, you will be short. Utilize ingredients efficiently and arrange your orders to accomplish this goal. While you're at it, make yourself a few to think straight. Full steam ahead!\ You must place cards that represent coffee ingredients and special orders within a 3x3 grid to score at least 7 tips.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: Carefully manage your ants to store food and expand the colony before winter arrives.
Long Description: In this game, you play as a colony of ants that is preparing for the coming winter. Each turn you place your ant workers on cards in your colony in order to take action. You will collect food and dig tunnels to build additional cards and expand your colony further. To win, you need to enter winter with 30 pieces of food in your stockpile and with 4 new cards built in your colony.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Military strategy game for 2 players
Long Description: Two infantry platoons duel on a chess-like board.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: Coach future bloodsport champions on the mean streets of a fantasy medieval city.
Long Description: Each player is the coach of a team represented by a deck of cards. Coaches position their teammates on the field, activate their unique actions and issue them commands in order to gain possession of the ball, push it into the opposing team‚Äôs half and score points. Choose a play-style from a diverse range of 12 teams - then mesh it with a second choice to form unique combinations.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: Friendly gnomes work and party through the holidays to prepare for St. Knut's Day.
Long Description: A game takes place on a calendar-themed board beginning on December 1st, culminating on St. Knut's Day on January 13th. Tasks performed will cause resources to be spent. As players collect task cards, they'll build an engine by adding each card's rewards to their train of completion rewards when working, playing, or partying on holidays.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: You are a paleontologist, trying to dig up the best fossils.
Long Description: Each round you will roll 2 dice and then use those dice to draw a shape with a certain dig type on the dig site. Once a fossil is completely surrounded, you can score it. After 20 rounds total your points earned from each fossil dug up, adding in bonuses. The player with the most points is the winner!

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Keep the sheep well fed and happy!
Long Description: A number of sheep (and four leaf clover) are randomly placed in a field. Your task is to help the sheep eat as much grass as they can. Each area of grazing is determined by the dice you roll. Completely grazed fields score more points. Do you risk losing one of your limited supply of treats to complete a field or move on to the next one and lose points for ungrazed areas?

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Roll Builder is a roll-and-write game of city building, discovery, and legacy.
Long Description: Each turn, the dice are rolled to provide strength to actions, including building networks of roads, placing buildings, and constructing great wonders of the world. Managing resources and forwarding each society through sheet-specific innovations give different paths to victory, whether each player plays the same sheet, or competes using different ones that have been carefully balanced.
Print Components: 1 player sheet (a city map of your choice), rules

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Prefect is a spin-off of the anticipated 2023 board game, Age of Rome.
Long Description: In the game, one or more players take the role of Prefect, an administrator of a Roman province managing religion, politics, farming, trade, and military. During each round, players roll three dice and select one to grow the province and two to apply as waste. Players balance growth and waste as well as carefully prioritize their choices to earn the most glory points.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Corinth is a roll-and-write game akin to a dice-only version of Yspahan.
Long Description: At the start of a turn, the active player rolls nine dice, sorts them by value and places them on the chart. The active player takes all the dice on one level, then the action associated with that level. After 16 turns (four players) or 18 turns (two or three players), the game ends and you tally points for goods delivered, spaces visited, buildings constructed, and goats and gold still on hand.
Print Components: 1 score sheet per player, 1 'harbor' sheet for everyone, rules

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: You are an apprentice cartographer, aiming to create the best map.
Long Description: Each turn players roll three dice. One tells them how much land and water they are drawing, while the total of the other two tell them what buildings or resources they can draw. Once each players map is full scoring is done, and the player with the highest score is the rewarded cartographer.
Print Components: 1 player sheet per player, 1 guide sheet for everyone, rules

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Goblin Dungeon 2: Design a dungeon with traps & goblin pals. Defend against random adventurers in this roll-&-write game!
Long Description: Goblin Dungeon 2 is a single-player roll-and-write game where you design a dungeon, fill it with traps and your goblin friends, and then see if you can defend your trinkets when a random party of adventurers attacks! This is a standalone sequel to the original Goblin Dungeon; however, if you own both, there are rules available to combine the two games.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: A city building roll & write game.
Long Description: The game takes place over three phases. First is the Construction Phase where you will erect your buildings, followed by the Time Phase where you will determine if it's day or night, and ending with the Occupancy Phase where your buildings are populated. Afterwards, players will score.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Bittyburg is a minimalist city planning game.
Long Description: Every turn, two dice are rolled. Choose one die as zone type and one die for the map row. Place buildings strategically to optimize economy. After 20 rounds, the player with the highest score wins.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Become the richest entrepreneur!
Long Description: Roll the dice three times to acquire loads of rental property, open bold new businesses, try your luck with some risky investments, and perhaps even win the lottery! Can you turn five dice into cool cash?

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Roll and write version of Dice Hospital
Long Description: Similar to Dice hospital where the dice are the patients, this flip, roll and write game is a standalone version that uses only 3 dice, a scoresheet, and custom cards.
Other Components: red, green and yellow dice. Something to write with

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: Place your dice for space combat
Long Description: Star Fighters: Rapid Fire combines the excitement of real-time dice rolling with tactical starship combat. Each player hops into the cockpit of their own starfighter and duels it out in a dog fight to prove who is the superior pilot. The game plays in multiple modes 1 vs 1, 3 player free-for-all, 2 vs 2, or a solo mode where a single starfighter attacks an orbital space station.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: A roll and write game about cacti thriving in the arid desert.
Long Description: Each turn, players will roll a set of dice that will determine the type and the location of their cacti. At the end of the round, only cacti that are in the sunlight will score, adding an extra layer of strategy to the game. Collect as many points as possible by placing your cacti in the best position on the grid.
Other Components: 4 six-sided dice (2 blue + 2 red) [solo game: 2 six-sided dice (1 blue + 1 red)], 1 pen/pencil

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Too many loose sheep, roll the die and fence them in!
Long Description: Each turn, players roll a die and draw a matching fence on the map. The game can last for 7 to 10 rounds, depending on the result of the die roll in the last 3 rounds. At the end of the game, each completely enclosed area will score the players points depending on the number of sheep within.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Build your own mini town in this quick roll & write.
Long Description: Each player chooses how to use the rolls of two dice. One die shows the location (row or column) for the construction. The other die shows the type of construction (road, park, house, library cafe or shop) that can be built. Build your infrastructure and services to best serve the community and, of course, to gain the most points!

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Use movement cards to rearrange Puffins and build igloos to save them from the bitter cold.
Long Description: In Pocket Puffins you will have 3 pattern cards and a row of 9 puffins. You will use your movement cards to help move the puffins into the correct position while also helping them build igloos to gain points. Be swift with your movements because time is limited and all 3 patterns need to be fulfilled before you run out of movement cards.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: A party game for adventurous adults who value enthusiastic consent
Long Description: Would you play Spin-the-Bottle if it only chose people who WANT to kiss each other? In Dare to Consent, you choose a two-person dare from the menu, then privately collect consent cards to see who might join you If you do the biggest dare on the menu, you get to choose the next even bigger dare. The dares keep escalating until your group reaches their limit.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Players are farmers puzzling together paddy cards to expand their family‚Äôs rice paddies to score the most points.
Long Description: In Seasons of Rice, Corry Damey‚Äôs 18-card tribute to his Cambodian heritage, players are farmers puzzling together paddy cards to expand their family‚Äôs ‚Äúlandscape‚Äù of rice paddies and ensure the most bountiful of harvests. Players will be drafting cards and placing them into their expanding landscape area to close off paddies in order to score the most points by the end of the game.

Designer: Rob Hicks, Aubrey Hicks, Matt Miller
PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Take the role of Goblins at the Breakfast table, scrambling to eat as much food as possible while preventing others.
Long Description: To start the game, a few cards are dealt out to the center table, and on each turn, players can do one: A, take a food or weapon B, If they have a bigger weapon than another player, they can steal another card from another player's hand. C, If they have a food card in hand they can eat it, scoring it. D, play a special action card from the center of the table, immediately playing its effects.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: A flip & write where the player's point of view matters.
Long Description: Players fill a grid with trominoes based on their own viewpoint of a shared card. Each turn a card is drawn, assigning each player a 4 symbol, and showing 4 trominoes (1 in each symbol). From their own point of view, players draw their symbol's tromino along with at least 1 other to their grid, not rotating them, scoring for their longest strings and losing points for their largest empty area.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: A 9-card word game where players try to be the first to think of a word that fits three different categories.
Long Description: Each card of the 9-card deck contains 4 conditions for a word or phrase, and is capable of creating thousands of conditions for the base game. Players flip cards from a center pile to the left and right, revealing 3 conditions, then try to be the fastest to think of a word or phrase which fits these conditions. Stumped? Each player can rotate one card once during a game to swap conditions.
Other Components: tokens for scoring (optional and depending on game mode)

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Use logic to activate all 9 cards of the grid.
Long Description: Logicards is a puzzle played with 9 cards in a 3x3 grid. Each card has an active and inactive side, and a number 1 to 9. The game begins with one random card active, and the goal of the puzzle is to get all cards to their active side. When a card is active, it has a chance to be an operator. Each turn, the player must perform the action on the operator card, which may move or flip cards.
Print Components: 1 page per set (4 sets in total)
Other Components: 3 optional tokens for Operator, Bomb, and Forecast

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: A series of in-hand puzzles on a small number of cards in different shapes that you flip, rotate, or move to solve.
Long Description: Shape-puzzles are a series of in-hand puzzles in different shapes and made up of between 2-5 cards each. The series consists of Triangles, Triangles II, Squares, Pentagons, Hexagons, and Octagons. Gameplay is similar, with the player needing to flip, rotate or move cards to get them in a specific order, but each is unique in how the player performs actions or in the goals they need to achieve.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: An in-hand word game where players find 5-letter words by rotating cards.
Long Description: A game about making words. Each player receives 5 double-sided square cards with a letter in each corner of the card. Players shuffle the cards and then begin play. They are allowed to rotate the cards, but not change their positions in the hand. Compete with others to find words the fastest or try to complete one of the many solo challenges! The unique design guarantees an answer every time!

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Escape a library full of horrors as the darkest hours unfold!
Long Description: You love reading books and enjoy spending time at your local library. But who would have guessed it could transform into a nightmare after midnight? As the darkest hours unfold, navigate the eerie halls of the haunted library, relying on your knowledge, dwindling stamina, and defense (thick books) to make it through the night!

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Scaffolding is a solo single page construction game.
Long Description: You are in charge of building the scaffolding on a construction site. You lead 2 teams, one on site and one in your workshop. Try to spread the work efficiently between both teams to reach the top of the building. Each turn, roll to see which materials you get. Use these to build platforms, ladders and cranes to climb up, complete tasks and gather bonuses.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: A card game multitool featuring components for playing a wide variety of games.
Long Description: * D4, D6, D8, D10, D12, D20 * 2 or 4 Standard 54 card playing card decks * 1-11 or 1-20 Triangular deck * 1-120 or 240 Sequential deck * 1 or 2 copies of a 6 suited, 20 ranked deck * Roles for Coup, common Werewolf versions * Double twenty dominoes * 5 nouns and 3 adjectives (960 total words) * Modifier/odd distribution deck

Game Title: Wasteland Convoy - A Post-Apocalyptic Retheme of Creature Caravan
Designer: Martin Gonzalvez (from the Ryan Laukat original)
PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Expert Crafting (100's of cards, many boards, many tiles and tokens, unique elements)
One-Sentence Short Description: Lead a ragtag caravan across a ruined wasteland, scavenging, surviving, and fighting raiders, to reach the last sanctuary.
Long Description: In Wasteland Convoy, players lead desperate groups of survivors across a shattered, post-apocalyptic landscape in search of the last safe haven. Along the way, they‚Äôll recruit scavengers, outwit raiders, barter with shady traders, and navigate dangerous terrain. Every decision tightens the tension as rival convoys and the relentless Smoke close in‚Äîonly one group will reach the sanctuary first.
Other Components: convoy token, 12 camp tokens, 15 cubes, 7d6 per player

Designer: Martin Gonzalvez (from an Edmund Johnson original)
PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: Pulp heroes work together to complete a thrilling mission.
Long Description: This is a graphical rework / retheme of the free PnP game Agents of Adventure. The game is a one-player adventure card game set in a fantastical version of 1920s and 1930s earth. Players lead a team of three heroes on a thrilling mission, their every move hindered by an evil mastermind and their dastardly minions.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Drill, dig, smelt, sell, and keep ahead of your bank while avoiding a CAVE-IN!
Long Description: The year is 1602 and the bank extends you a 50 pound loan. In a race against time and the elements, you venture into the world of mining. Drill, dig, smelt, sell, and keep ahead of your bank loan as you strive to strike it rich. Weigh your odds carefully before excavating to maximize profit while avoiding a CAVE-IN!

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Arrange all 13 Magpies in order before the Spectre of Sorrows destroys the forest or a cursed Magpie triggers a loss.
Long Description: In One for Sorrow, you are one of the ancient Cunning Folk, guardians of the Magpies and protectors of the forest. An ancient threat has returned‚Äîthe Spectre of Sorrows, a demonic hunter consumed by hatred for magpies. Long ago, the magpies defied the Spectre, stealing an artefact it once held dear. Now, the Spectre relentlessly seeks vengeance, cursing the forest and destroying nests as it hunts.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: One roll, many paths: Outsmart your rivals to become the ultimate potion master!
Long Description: Jujuman is a single-sheet roll-and-write game of exploration and potion crafting. On a turn, three dice (red, green, and black) are rolled for all players. Each player uses the dice to simultaneously fill potion bottles with strategic number placements, move across the map, and collect ingredients like mushrooms, feathers, and worms.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: A 1v1 tactical abstract strategy game with some interesting asymmetric powers and unique interactions.
Long Description: Immerse into a very hot and dry desert where animals strive to stay hydrated against the radiating heat. These animals carry fruits from the native cacti in their mouths because cactus fruit store water inside of them and are a quick snack for the animals in need. The goal of the game is to consume 3 sources of water or to scare off your opponent‚Äôs animals.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Get the best overall time and win the world's hardest rally!
Long Description: Welcome to DKR Rally Raid, considered one of the toughest and most famous rallies in the world. Try to finish each stage in the shortest time possible, carefully following the roadbook. Overcome the inconveniences that arise, taking care of the car from the difficulties of the terrain and enduring the unfavorable weather to win this difficult competition. Let's race!
Other Components: 4 dices (two different colors), 16 cubes (4 of a different color, and the rest of one singular)

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: A mecha-themed dueling game that you can play using ANY deck of cards.
Long Description: Circle of Power is a free mecha-themed print & play game that you can play using ANY deck of cards. Yes, ANY! Print out a Fighter sheet for both players, grab some dice and cards, and you‚Äôre good to go!

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: Survive the darkness of the underworld as a lone survivor of a monster attack.
Long Description: Unbroken is a solo card game that is quick to set up and play but one that will produce a tense challenging experience. Collect resources representing your character's abilities. Invest in a right mix of resources to both keep yourself alive during your travels and also prepare for the gruesome monsters that wait in the dark. Use brute force, trickery, or clever use of skills.

Designer: Mike Boxleiter, Tommy Maranges, Max Temkin
PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: In pre-WW2 Germany, Liberals and Fascists square off in an intrigue-filled parliament
Long Description: Secret Hitler is a dramatic game of political intrigue and betrayal set in 1930s Germany. Each player is randomly and secretly assigned to be a liberal or a fascist, and one player is Secret Hitler. The fascists coordinate to sow distrust and install their cold-blooded leader; the liberals must find and stop the Secret Hitler before it's too late. The liberal team always has a majority.

Game Title: Movie Mayhem: A Movie Studio Retheme of Funfair
Designer: Martin Gonzalvez, from an original by Joel Finch
PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Advanced Crafting (many cards, folding boards, tiles, circle tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: Compete to create the most successful movie studio
Long Description: Movie Mayhem is a fast-paced, hilarious board game (a retheme of Funfair) where players compete to build the most profitable movie studio by building up a tableau of over-the-top film tropes, ridiculous genre mashups, and scene-stealing characters. With tongue-in-cheek art and pun-packed card titles, taglines, and fake dialogue, Movie Mayhem is sure to tickle the fancy of any Tinseltown fan.
Print Components: 56 including cards, game board, and coin tokens
Other Components: One step tracker and one first player token

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: It was a trap! Roll your crew dice to survive the onslaught of an alien armada.
Long Description: Deep Space D-6 is a solitaire dice game about surviving the cruel depths of space. Each turn you‚Äôll roll Crew dice and assign them to stations. You must plan carefully to take care of internal and external threats to your ship. Survive to win.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)

Long Description: A solitaire card game of balance, balance and nothing but balance. Tightrope Terror dares you to cross its titular rope and face your fears up high. Each turn, choose from a limited hand of cards: either play them to shift your balance and momentum, or foster them for their useful abilities and Happy Memories, helping you fight off creeping vertigo.
Print Components: 28 cards (4 pages - A4), 1 double-sided board, 1 optional playmat

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)

Over four rounds, you must collect the necessary resources in vital territories, fulfill objectives, and raise as many kits as possible while developing their instincts. The player who accumulates the most victory points (VP) wins the game.

Using a 3x3 grid of chamber cards and a deck of 9 intruder cards, you'll manage two key resources: Serpent's Eyes (to turn enemies to stone) and Memory (to sanctify chambers or befriend commoners). The intruder deck acts as an automated opponent, deploying Warriors, Priests, and Commoners with unique behaviors that create dynamic threats and moral choices.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)

Long Description:
Each round begins with a bidding phase in which the knights brag about how many beasts they will slay (and thus how many tricks the player will have to win).

Then the trick-taking begins, with players laying successively higher head and tail cards to construct a huge beast. Players must play cards higher in value than those already played, but can do so at either end of the trick.

The player who plays the final card takes the trick.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Quick Print (no crafting required)
One-Sentence Short Description: Some films should never be screened.
Long Description: Hollywood, 1947. You're a film scholar who's discovered something the studios don't want you to know. Those German Expressionist silent films from the 1920s? The ones with the impossible shadows and angles that make your eyes hurt? They're not just art. They're dangerous.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Moderate Assembly (cards, boards, tiles, square tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: 2 Player card game where you are an Artiste enticing Muses to your studio.
Long Description:
In Prisma, you are an Artiste preparing for the grand Prisma Exhibition. On your turn, either INSPIRE by playing Prism cards from your hand to match the Hues required by a Muse card, adding both to your studio, or ENTICE by drawing two new cards from the decks or rows. 
You begin the game by selecting two Signature Hues; at game‚Äôs end, you score points for your Muses‚Äô Inspiration Values and for the Resonance of only the Prisms that match your Signature Hues.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Advanced Crafting (many cards, folding boards, tiles, circle tokens)
One-Sentence Short Description: A Darkly Beautiful Trick-Taking Puzzle for Two
Long Description: Using a unique twist on trick-taking, you win majestic beasts from a deck of authentically restored antique heraldic art and must carefully place them in your personal gallery. Each round, a fickle Royal Crest changes which creature reigns supreme, while secret decrees and cursed shapeshifter cards weave a layer of gothic intrigue. It‚Äôs a tactical battle of wits, set collection, and spatial puzzle-solving, wrapped in a breathtaking artifact of hand-crafted history.

PnP Crafting Challenge Level: Simple Cuts (a few cards or tiles)
One-Sentence Short Description: Your obsession with polyominoes has led you to buy an expensive laser cutter.
Long Description:
Lasercut is a solo game in which the player attempts to cut 20 unique 6-cell polyominoes (hexominoes) and a first player token for their latest game design.

Each round, the player tries to design a hexomino by rolling and connecting dice on the Mobile Polyomino Designer (MPD). When a new hexomino is designed, it is cut (drawn) on the acrylic, allowing the player to collect dopamine and powerful bonuses. Hexominoes are recorded on the Hexomino Guide as a reminder that they can not be cut again.
Other Components: 3 D6 Dice + Something to Write With

One-Sentence Short Description: You are the world's worst DJ; scratch up a record in style.
Long Description: Place samples, travel away to increase their value, then visit your samples to score points.
Other Components: Pencil, three four-sided dice, and optionally a ruler
